moment.name: moment.js
moment.code:
<script>

const date = moment().format('MMMM Do YYYY, h:mm:ss a')

log(date)
  
</script>
moment.text:
The moment.js library allows us to express the date string we want in a single simple function. We do this by passing a string with the format we want the string written in, where M stands for 'month', D for day of the month, Y for year, d for day of the week, h for hour, m for minute, s for second. You can also use a for am/pm and o for oridinal indicators like 'st', 'nd', 'rd' and 'th'. NOTE: clicking on "open in netnet" won't work properly for this example unless you import the library at the top of your netnet sketch:
<script src="https://momentjs.com/downloads/moment.js"></script>
